intro: Rollandia humboldtiana var. tomentella, commonly known as the Humboldt's rollandia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, tomentose leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
